column3: Adalberta has a mind to teach you about materia.

You learn that Deep Canyon used to be Adalberta's friend and mentor, but that something has driven a wedge between them. Though they do not see eye to eye on many things, Adalberta concurs with Deep Canyon's advice on the matter of equipment, and proposes materia as a means to augment your gear. With this in mind, she bids you obtain ninety-nine fragments of grade 1 carbonized matter, a catalyst used in the materia melding process. Dig for the substance around the De Nevelle Checkpoint in middle La Noscea, and deliver the required amount to Adalberta.

Adalberta explains that materia can only be attached to equipment by Disciples of the Hand, but that the process requires myriad catalysts which can only be procured by Disciples of the Land. It would seem a mutually beneficial arrangement is in order.\x02\x10\x01\x03\x02\x10\x01\x03\xe2\x80\xbbThe next miner quest will be available from Adalberta upon reaching level 25.
Deliver fragments of grade 1 carbonized matter to Adalberta.

Ah, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03. I hear you passed the vice foreman's test. Well done. I never doubted that you'd manage it\xe2\x94\x80but I'm proud of you, all the same. Tell me, did Deep Canyon have any words of advice for you, by any chance?
...I see. In case you're wondering, the vice foreman used to be a miner himself. But more than that, he used to be my mentor.
My father was a miner too, but he died in a cave-in when I was but a child. The guild's been as a home to me since, and its members my family.
I grew up here, watching girls sing and dance on that very stage...
I even joined them for a while. It seemed the best way to please my adopted family.
I didn't want to become a miner back then, you see. After what happened to my father, I could scarcely face the thought of spending a moment underground, never mind a lifetime.

Not that the stage suited me much better... Which left what, exactly? Having been surrounded by miners for as long as I could remember, I began to wonder if I truly belonged among them. I even considered leaving. It was then that one of the guild's brightest and best took me by the hand and showed me the joys of mining. I speak, of course, of Deep Canyon.
He taught me everything he knew\xe2\x94\x80which was a great deal\xe2\x94\x80and the more I learned of mining, the closer I felt to my father.
I owe a lot to Deep Canyon...despite how things turned out.
But I'm rambling. I meant only to tell you that the man knows what he's talking about\xe2\x94\x80when it comes to mining, at least.
Now, it's high time I taught you something. You are here to learn, after all.
It concerns the vice foreman's advice to you...
He speaks true\xe2\x94\x80a miner who neglects his gear can't hope to work to his full potential.
In the past, if you wanted to improve your gear, you had little choice but to replace it. But these days, we have materia.

By your confused expression, I take it you're not familiar with the stuff. Simply put, materia's a kind of crystal that can be used to enhance equipment. The process calls for substances known as catalysts, one of which I want you to try your hand at mining\xe2\x94\x80namely, grade one carbonized matter.
Ninety-nine fragments ought to do it. You'll have the best luck searching around the De Nevelle Checkpoint, over in middle La Noscea. Oh, and you'll most definitely need your sledgehammer.
How goes your search for carbonized matter? Don't forget, it's ninety-nine fragments I want.
Aye, precisely ninety-nine fragments of grade one carbonized matter. Well done, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03.

Now, I expect you're keen to learn about materia. Well, the first thing I should tell you is that it's not been around for long\xe2\x94\x80in Eorzea at least. Knowledge of its use only came to our shore a few years back.
The process of enhancing equipment goes something like this: first you take well-worn gear and convert it into materia\xe2\x94\x80don't ask me how.
You then take that materia and attach it to the item you want to enhance.

It's this procedure, known as \xe2\x80\x9cmelding,\xe2\x80\x9d that requires catalysts like the kind you brought me. I should mention at this point that the actual task of melding is something that only skilled Disciples of the Hand should attempt\xe2\x94\x80that's weavers, goldsmiths, and so on.
Of course, these people wouldn't be able to do their work if Disciples of the Land like ourselves didn't supply them with catalysts. Both parties have an essential role to play.
Now, there're various kinds of materia, each offering unique benefits.
And, as I'm sure you've guessed, some of them can be exceedingly useful to miners. It's these which I recommend you seek out.

Seeing as you've got all this carbonized matter, why not come to an arrangement with a friendly Disciple of the Hand? I'll bet there's one among your acquaintances who'd be willing to meld some materia to an item of your choosing.
